body_content.explanation: the maximum speed at which a vehicle is able to travel continuously and comfortably, without using a large amount of fuel or effort:
examples: The aircraft have a cruising speed of 300 miles per hour.
When the plane reaches cruising speed, we start to relax.
Initial assessments indicate that the vessel hit the shallowest part of the reef at cruising speed, about 24 knots.
The car moved along at a steady cruising speed, meeting very little traffic.

body_content.explanation: a time when someone or something is operating continuously and successfully, with little difficulty or effort:
examples: After more than 20 years, he is at cruising speed in his job.
Some TV shows take off from the first episode while others need time to reach cruising speed.
